safenet.jhsm.misc

Class echo_cmd

  • java.lang.Object
    • safenet.jhsm.misc.echo_cmd

  • public class echo_cmd
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the Java equivalent of HSM echo command (ECHO_CMD). The echo command is used as a ping mechanism for the HSM

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      echo_cmd(byte[] payload)
      Initializes the echo_cmd class.
      echo_cmd(int size, byte pattern)
      Initializes the echo_cmd class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int cmd_size()
      Returns the length of echo_cmd message.
      byte[] cmd()
      Returns the final form of echo_cmd.
      int id()
      Returns the command ID
      int payload_size()
      Returns the length of payload only.
      byte[] payload()
      Returns the user specified payload (bit pattern buffer).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • echo_cmd

        public echo_cmd(int size,
                byte pattern)

        Initializes the echo_cmd class.

        This constructor is called when user would like to build and echo command with fixed pattern.

        Parameters:
        size - Size of payload. Expressed in bytes.
        pattern - Bit pattern
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If an exception occur

      • echo_cmd

        public echo_cmd(byte[] payload)

        Initializes the echo_cmd class.

        This constructor is called when user would like to build and echo command using a custom pattern. This constructor expects an array of byte. The size will be derived automatically by this class.

        Parameters:
        payload - Bit patterns expressed as arrays of byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If an exception occur

    • Method Detail

      • cmd_size

        public int cmd_size()

        Returns the length of echo_cmd message. This value will include the length of payload + header

        Returns:
        No. of bytes

      • payload_size

        public int payload_size()

        Returns the length of payload only.

        Returns:
        No. of bytes

      • id

        public int id()

        Returns the command ID

        Returns:
        Command ID

      • payload

        public byte[] payload()

        Returns the user specified payload (bit pattern buffer). Note that user method is only provided as a tool for user to debug their payload. It will not work if user pass this byte buffer to MD_SendReceive

        Method cmd should be used in all cases.

        Returns:
        Byte arrays corresponding to payload
        See Also:
        cmd

      • cmd

        public byte[] cmd()

        Returns the final form of echo_cmd. User should always use this method to generate the byte buffer which MD_SendReceive understands.

        Returns:
        Byte arrays corresponding to payload and associated header information.
